file_content.text: Sergeant, I thought my orders were very clear. You aren't supposed to be here.
Commander Tavus? What are you doing?
What's going on here?
You'd better tell me what this is about, Commander.
I want an explanation.
This entire mission was a lie! You've betrayed us--betrayed the Republic!
You're traitors!
I will take her.
I will take him.
No, Wraith. The sergeant deserves to know the truth.
I had hoped it wouldn't come to this. I harbor no ill will toward you. You're everything a warrior should be.
But I'm afraid the Republic no longer values her warriors--even the very best among them.
You've fought the Empire for years--do you really think things are better over there?
How can you believe that?
The Empire respects warriors, Sergeant. The Republic's top officials, on the other hand, have decided to cast us aside.
All of you swore to protect the Republic from its enemies.
That's no excuse.
Those oaths were sworn to a Republic that doesn't exist anymore, Sergeant.
You're afraid you can't cut it anymore, so you're changing sides.
Only cowards defect.
You couldn't be further from the truth, Sergeant.
The truth is that no matter what they may say, the Republic Senate doesn't actually believe it can win another war against the Empire.
That makes you and I a threat. Every Havoc Squad victory fires up people's imaginations, fills them with pride--which means the bureaucrats can't afford to let us keep succeeding.
We can win, Tavus. We have to win. The Imperials must be defeated.
But we can beat the Empire!
How is the outright tyranny of the Empire any better?
Bureaucrats? Are you serious?
You've really lost it. What you're saying--it's absurd.
That's just paranoid nonsense.
If only you'd been with us longer, Sergeant, you would understand. You might've even come with us.
The Republic abandoned us. During a mission on Ando Prime, they simply left us to die.
But I won't try to persuade you. Honestly, I hope you die with your ideals intact. The rest of us will never have that luxury.
It's not too late, Tavus. You can still turn back.
You don't have to do this.
Turn back to what? The Republic that wants me dead and gone? No, Sergeant, I think not.
I would never become a traitor like you, Tavus.
I'd never betray the Republic.
Yes, I suspected as much.
Surrender right now, or I'll have no option but to take you all down.
You leave me no choice.
I'm sorry, Sergeant, but you'll be the only member of Havoc Squad to die today.
Oh, uh, by the way, good work finding the ZR-57 for us. We were starting to worry that the separatists might, you know, waste our big present for the Empire.
But thanks to you, we can now present the Empire with this magnificent tool of destruction.
The Imperials won't be very impressed once they realize the bomb is neutralized.
Too bad I deactivated it.
A clever bluff, Sergeant, but it won't help you.
Glad I could contribute to your treason.
Very funny.
Assuming you leave here alive.
You never lacked courage, but I'm afraid that courage will not help you now.
We'd better get a move on, boss. If we don't break atmo in the next few minutes, every gun in the sky will have a clear shot on us.
Time we were off. Colonel Vorr? Please give the sergeant the warrior's death she deserves.
Time we were off. Colonel Vorr? Please give the sergeant the warrior's death he deserves.
Let's see what you've got!
Bring it on!
Go ahead and run. Someone's gonna catch you eventually.
You're all cowards.
You'll regret this, Tavus. I won't rest until I've taken you down.
This isn't over.
It's been an honor serving with you, Sergeant. Goodbye.
You have the coordinates for the supply outpost on Mannett Point, Sergeant. Wraith is going to rendezvous with you inside, so move out.
Bellis discovered that the separatists have the ZR-57 securely inside their supply outpost on Mannett Point, a small island just off the coast.
I sent Wraith ahead to reconnoiter the outpost, and she successfully located a secure area where we believe the bomb is stored.
Judging by the dramatic increase in the number of guards and the complex security systems installed, we're certain the bomb is there.
Honestly, with security like this, Mannett Point looks more like an Imperial military base than a separatist hideout to me. I think the seps are getting a helping hand, Commander.
From the Imperials? That seems unlikely, Lieutenant. Surely our spies would have discovered any Imperial involvement on Ord Mantell long before now.
The seps do seem to be unusually well equipped, Commander.
The lieutenant has a point.
Fighting Imperials is what I signed up for. I say bring 'em on.
I'd love to find Imps here.
You said it, Sergeant.
Why would the Imps care what happens on Ord Mantell?
Jorgan is just paranoid.
The whole reason the separatists are trying to leave the Republic is so they can join the Empire, Sergeant. It's obvious the Imperials would want to get involved.
We can discuss the possibility of any Imperial connections later. Let's focus on the mission at hand.
Wraith can't breach the secured area of the Mannett Point outpost alone, so I'm sending you in immediately.
Just tell me what to do.
I'm ready for duty, sir.
Sounds exciting.
Nice to know I'm your second choice for these kinds of ops, Commander.
I should have been sent first.
This isn't a popularity contest, Sergeant. You each have your own specialties. And right now, I need your specialties inside that outpost.
The Mannett Point bridge is out of commission, so you'll have to make an amphibious approach to that island.
When you arrive, effect entry into the supply outpost and rendezvous with Wraith inside. She'll give you further instructions at that time. Understood?
Yes, sir.
Before I go, sir, there's a lieutenant named Virk running a bribery scheme with the men under his command.
I need to report corruption.
Virk? I know the guy. He's a pretty pathetic officer, but nobody's ever made any official complaints--none that I heard about, anyway.
Lieutenant Jorgan and I will see to this. You should get moving to Mannett Point, so that you can rendezvous with Wraith inside the separatist outpost. Dismissed.
Bust in, find the green lady and do what she tells me to--got it.
Sounds easy.
This mission is gravely important, Sergeant. Many lives depend on your success. Dismissed.
Ah, welcome back, Sergeant. Good work dealing with that ambush--I'm sure the troopers from Forty-fifth Infantry will be singing your praises for some time.
Only because they don't know how reluctant the sergeant was to help them. You would have let your fellow soldiers die!
It won't happen again, Lieutenant. You have my word.
I'm very sorry.
Let's move on, people. We have an important new mission to discuss.
Stopping random ambushes isn't my assignment.
My objective is the ZR-57.
This is a war, Lieutenant--and sometimes, people die in wars.
Casualties are inevitable.
Enough! We have an important new mission. There's no time for this pointless bickering.
Ah, Sergeant--good to see you again. Superb work on that ambush situation--adaptability like that is what Havoc Squad is all about.
You're too kind.
I have other good news as well.
We're no closer to finding the bomb than we were before.
Still no ZR-57, unfortunately.
Not for long--I have good news.
I don't know how many more false leads I can take.
The whole op was a waste.
It isn't a false lead if it saves lives. But you should be happy to hear this next piece of news.
Lieutenant Jorgan has finished reviewing the intel from Bellis's field box. It's given us a real breakthrough.
Did Bellis manage to uncover the ZR-57's hiding place?
What have we learned?
He did, Sergeant.
Good to know the guy managed to do something besides get shot.
So Bellis wasn't useless.
Turns out Bellis was actually pretty good at his job.
Don't keep me in suspense.
You should hurry to Talloran and rendezvous with Bellis, Sergeant. Time is a luxury we cannot afford.
Now, the reason we're all here: A Republic transport, carrying among its cargo a ZR-57 orbital strike bomb, crashed in northern Avilatan six days ago.
Recovery unit sent a team, but they were too late. Separatist forces had already stolen the transport's cargo, including the ZR-57, and fled.
Someone on our side must have tipped the seps off.
Sounds like we have a leak.
Yes, we've considered that possibility--but we don't have time for a mole hunt. Recovering that bomb is priority one.
What are the ZR-57's capabilities, sir?
How dangerous is this bomb?
Nothing like risking your life cleaning up somebody else's mess.
I hate cleanup ops.
It's a mess--there's no doubt about that. But Havoc Squad wasn't formed to do the easy jobs. We will retrieve this bomb.
The ZR-57 is--well, it's serious hardware, you know? I mean, it can pretty much vaporize this whole island. So, we'd better get it back or, well, boom.
We're investigating several leads to the bomb's location, but the one I'd like you to look into, Sergeant, comes from a Republic spy named Bellis.
Bellis reported making an important discovery, but he's in too deep to exfiltrate for a full report. Instead, you'll rendezvous with Bellis in a nearby village called Talloran.
Very well.
I should warn you, Sergeant: Talloran is separatist-controlled territory. Expect armed resistance.
Has there been a comm malfunction? Or are all of this guy's meets face-to-face?
Why can't Bellis call it in?
Comms are risky here. The separatists have signal tappers everywhere.
Any grunt could do this op, sir.
This is a waste of my skills.
Getting in and out of Talloran is more difficult than you might imagine. The separatist armed guards are everywhere.
Bellis will meet you in a small alley in Talloran. Find out what he's discovered, then return to the base immediately. Understood?
Yes, sir.
What if Bellis's information doesn't lead us to the bomb, sir?
And if the intel isn't useful?
Then we will have one less lead requiring our attention.
This won't be challenging.
I think you may find the operation more taxing than you expect.
I have one last introduction to make: This is Lieutenant Aric Jorgan, an operations officer from the Republic's Ord Mantell Infantry Command.
Since we're on individual missions to search for this bomb, Lieutenant Jorgan is coordinating our efforts from here within the mission room.
All right, Sergeant, I'll be overseeing your op through the camera mounted on your armor, so I see what you see. It's activated when you leave the fort.
I'll make this completely clear, rookie--when you're in the field, what I say goes. Period.
Got it.
I can handle myself, sir.
I'm no rookie.
Other members of Havoc have proven themselves on dozens of ops, Sergeant. You haven't.
Commander Tavus is my CO, Lieutenant.
I don't take orders from you.
Lieutenant Jorgan is a superior officer. I expect you to show him the same respect you would show me.
Just make your way to Talloran, meet with Bellis, and find out what he knows without screwing anything up.
Make me proud. Show these separatists what Havoc is made of!
I'll get that intel for us, Commander.
You can count on me, sir.
There isn't a doubt in my mind.
Time to get back in the fight.
Good luck in Talloran, Sergeant. Dismissed.
Time for the real soldiers to go to work.
Enjoy the show, Jorgan.
That will do, Sergeant. Dismissed.
Yes, so if we focus our efforts on M-sector, I'm certain that--Sergeant! Welcome, welcome!
Good to have you here. I'm Commander Harron Tavus, Havoc Squad's commanding officer. We're all excited to have some new blood in the unit.
I'm honored to be joining the very best unit in the Republic, Commander.
It's a pleasure, sir.
I'm glad to hear it!
Will you be giving me my assignments from now on, sir?
Are you my commanding officer?
That's correct, Sergeant.
Let's let the enemy do the bleeding, sir.
I'll keep my blood to myself.
Hah! I like her already.
Hah! I like him already.
Let me introduce you to the other members of Havoc Squad.
My second-in-command, Captain Zora, is the squad's infiltration and assassination specialist. We call her Wraith.
Sergeant.
This is Fuse--Lieutenant Vanto Bazren. He's an expert with every type of explosive in the known galaxy.
Oh, uh, yes, hello, Sergeant, hello. Good to meet you.
And this is Needles, Lieutenant Ryler Dorant. Needles is a medical genius--he's particularly adept at synthesizing powerful new combat stimulants and adrenals.
Perfection is my art, Sergeant. It will be my honor to help you perform at your very best.
And of course, you met Gearbox on your way here, so that's everyone.
People, this is the new sergeant I mentioned--ranked first in the Academy in Forward Assault, Search and Destroy, and Advance Recon. It's good to have you, Sergeant.
It's a real pleasure to meet all of you.
Thanks, Commander.
I look forward to showing you what I can do.
Wait until you see me work.
We're all looking forward to seeing you in action, Sergeant.
When do we start busting heads, Commander? I'm ready for some action!
Let's get started!
Soon enough, trooper, soon enough.
Welcome, Sergeant.
Good day.
